choices.description: lightweight, non-blocking web server (standalone)
a functional micro web framework based on ASP.NET Core
web development framework which implements the server-side MVC pattern
don't add any CSS framework
add Fulma basic template
add Fulma with 'Admin' Bulma template from https://dansup.github.io/bulma-templates/
add Fulma with 'Cover' Bulma template from https://dansup.github.io/bulma-templates/
add Fulma with 'Hero' Bulma template from https://dansup.github.io/bulma-templates/
add Fulma with 'Landing' Bulma template from https://dansup.github.io/bulma-templates/
add Fulma with 'Login' Bulma template from https://dansup.github.io/bulma-templates/
don't add any additional libraries for client-server communication
add Fable.Remoting (https://zaid-ajaj.github.io/Fable.Remoting/) to server and client
add Elmish.Bridge (https://github.com/Nhowka/Elmish.Bridge) to server and client
add both Elmish.Bridge and Fable.Remoting to server and client
use standard Elmish architecture with Commands
use simple Elmish architecture without Commands + Elmish.Streams (https://elmish-streams.readthedocs.io/) for reactive pattern
obsolete - use `streams` (Fable.Reaction rebranded to Fable.Streams)
uses NPM for JS package management
uses Yarn for JS package management
don't add FAKE targets to deploy
additional FAKE targets to deploy to Azure App Service
additional FAKE targets to bundle and build Docker image
additional FAKE targets to deploy to Google Cloud AppEngine
additional FAKE targets to publish to gcp container registry and deploy to google kubernetes engine
FAKE targets and client paths normalization to easily publish the application to IIS
additional FAKE targets to deploy on Heroku
